derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: plural of ephemeron, from Greek, neuter of ephēmeros 'lasting only a day'. As a singular noun the word originally denoted a plant said by ancient writers to last only one day, or an insect with a short lifespan, and hence was applied (late 18th cent.) to a person or thing of short-lived interest. Current use has been influenced by plurals such as trivia and memorabilia

entry.def: You can refer to things which last for only a short time as ephemera .

entry.tran: 只在短期内有用之物;（短期内有用之物的）收藏品
entry.def: Ephemera is things people collect such as old postcards, posters, and bus tickets, which were only intended to last a short time when they were produced.

example.tran: 票据和其他短时效的印刷品
维多利亚时期短时效用品的收藏

means.word_mean: 2. an insect that lives only for a day in its winged form
